inn1.comm: length ball, around off stump, Perera wristily dabs it down into the covers and scampers up the other end
pitched up, 85mph and thudding into the pads, pitched outside leg... and it rolls away square
slightly full from Woakes and Gunathilaka drives, off the inner half of the bat past mid-on for three
floated up, 86mph and in the slot to drive and Perera nails it straight to cover
good length on the stumps, defended
full length in the channel again, Perera hammers it to the man on the edge of the ring again
ooh, that's a corking delivery first up! Good length, shaping in on off stump and then curling away past the outside edge as Gunathilaka felt for it
just outside off, holding its line again, tapped down towards cover point
fullish, creeping forwards as the ball shapes away, prodded in front of square again
Willey gets a bit too straight this time, only 78mph and nudged off the hips for one
slings the ball down the leg side as Perera moves across - wide
sliding down the leg side, Perera flicks... and there's a sound, Buttler tumbling to catch the ball low to his right. Reiffel shakes his head, he knows it tickled the pad - or the strap, in fact
Willey drifts on to the legs again, this is clipped in front of fine leg for a couple
full length in the channel outside off, sliced away, in the air but safe and third man has to run round to keep them to one
lovely stroke from Perera, draws himself up to his full height of 4ft 10in and punches square off the back foot, runs away to a fairly short boundary at deep point
short outside off again and this is carved through the covers on the up, muscular blow from Kusal, back-to-back fours
straighter line from Woakes, defended on theback foot
four more, rolls his hands on a pull and it's struck too sweetly for fine leg to be able to get round and cut it off!
full outside off and he leans into a drive this time, nicely timed and mid-off can't quite get down to it, takes some of the pace off but they pick up two
pitched up and lofted over cover! Gunathilaka strikes cleanly through the line, plenty of hang time on this but there was no one outside the ring and it bounces a couple of yards short the rope
good length ball, tapped down into the off side

bit of awayswing, Gunathilaka reaches for the drive... and spoons to cover! Bairstow grabs it and tosses the ball skyward as England celebrate their breakthrough, bit of a waft from Gunathilaka, reaching for the ball as it left him and he picked out the fielder
angled across the right-hander from over the wicket, slightly short and wide and Mendis latches on to it straight away, cracked behind square but Jason Roy fields it well
pitched up on middle and off, drives with the bottom hand coming off the bat, mistimed down the track
woof, a lovely tempter from Willey, slides it through past the outside edge! Not quite full enough to drive, the ball didn't swing back, either, and Mendis was lucky to play inside the line
full on the stumps, flicked through midwicket for a couple
back of a length, over middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
Kusal is batting right on the edge of his crease, he waits for a slower ball and dabs it down square
Perera stays on off stump and defends to the off side
back of a length in the channel, stands up on top of the bounce and punches to extra cover
pitched up a bit further, looking for some inswing on off stump, mistimed drive back down the ground
angled across on a good length, blocked coming forwards
slightly full and swinging in... to be met by a swinging blade as Mendis clubs powerfully to leg, hits it really well and Plunkett, in the deep, can't cut it off on the dive
back of a length, chopped down towards extra cover
length ball on the pads, Mendis moves across and executes a cute little pick up... that soars up, up and away over fine leg. No one out but he cleared the rope anyway, for the first six of the day
pushed across the bows, good length and left alone
short and wide and slapped through point, scorched off the middle and practically through the fielder put there - possibly Roy - away for another boundary. Mendis looking confident
cutter from Woakes, taking the pace off, Perera defends watchfully
crumped over mid-on for four more! Perera advances on a slightly short ball and clubs it away, Woakes whistles through his teeth. Shot
pushed across outside off, tapped down into the covers
length around off stump, another offcutter, defended
shortish, on the body, nudged away square off the back foot
slightly back of a length, outside off and steered through gully for one
pitched up and shaping in a fraction on off stump, driven slightly wide of mid-off and they pinch one

swing for Willey, straightens and takes the leading edge... and Roy grabs a blinder at backward point! He fair flew to his right to scoop up the chance, Perera trying to turn the ball off his body but closing the face fatally as it held its line. Willey leaps and roars and England, Yorkshire, Northampton, Surrey and, er, Durban have another!
pitched up full, threatening to coming back in from outside off, Chandi judges it well enough and shoulders arms
sliding across in the channel, shuffles back and across and lets it go
full outside off and this time Chandimal snaps into action, drilling the ball delicately through point, three fielders giving chase but they won't pull it in
draws his length back, this climbs through past the outside edge as Chandimal fiddles indiscreetly
good length, good pace, blocked back on off stump
slightly full and steered through backward point for one
pitched up in the channel, 86mph and punched past extra cover coming forwards, another comfortable single

banged in short, Kusal goes to hook - but can only glove it through to Buttler! That wasn't his most skilful bit of work, done for pace and bounce, I think, and Rob Bailey's finger goes up straight away, Woakes is amongst them and England have hit back strongly
Woakes floats the ball up on off stump, drops the bat on it, somewhat ponderously but a solid block
86mph, banged in and hitting the splice as Mathews defends from the crease
over the wicket to the right-hander, who defends coming forwards on off stump

shuffles on to the front foot and dabs into the covers, Chandimal sets off and calls for one... but this will be tight if Bairstow hits! he doesn't, by a whisker, but Chandi would have been a goner. Nearly an instance of seppuku from SL's No. 4
at the body, back of a length, worked away through backward square leg
past the outside edge, Chandimal feeling for it from the crease! Worried about it swinging back in, the ball slides on through to the keeper
touch short of a good length, again Chandi hangs his bat out in the wind
tip and run into the covers again, this time YJB tumbles over trying to gather the ball and they make it home safeyl
tossed up around the line of off, not much turn and defended coming forwards
flighted legbreak outside off stump, pushed gently into the covers
drops a little short this time, goes back and cuts in front of square to the sweeper
tossed up and there's appreciable turn and bounce for Rashid, Mathews thinks better of following it
fuller length, gets on to the front foot and drives to long-off
pushed through outside off, Chandi steers to point - decent start from Rashid
rumbles in, 84mph on a fourth-stump line, Mathew defends
pitched up a little further, Mathews comes forward and blocks to mid-off
good length, around off stump, Mathews goes to drive and gets an inside edge towards mid-on, the bottom hand coming off the bat
in the channel, 85mph and prodded away
full and tailing on middle and leg, Mathews cocks the wrists and pings a single through midwicket
short ball to finish the over, rolls the wrists on a pull down to fine leg for one more
floated up around middle and off, dabbed down
Chandimal pokes the ball into the covers and sets off, only for Mathews to decline the run, sending his partner scampering back
pushed through, hits the inside half of the bat as Chandi plays away from his pad
slightly too full, Chandimal reaches out and laps it away through backward square leg
flat and a bit quicker, defended on the stumps
pushed through on off stump, pushed into the covers - just one off the over, England tamping down on the run rate effectively here
comes forward to defend a length ball on off stump
pitched up and worked back towards mid-on, there's a direct hit after fielding but the batsman was in at the non-striker's end
full and straight and worked off the pads to deep backward square leg`
back of a length, tries to flick it away but doesn't connect
short outside off, 87mph and slashed hard off the back foot, well stopped by Roy... who then hits the stumps with his throw, too
turned off the body for one into the leg side
flighted, around off stump, pushed away
gives this some air, Chandimal goes down to sweep and gets a top edge over the keeper! Just enough on it, nearly whacked Buttler between the eyes, and it runs away from slip as well
tossed up, comes forward to drive down the ground
on off stump, Mathews punches one more down to long-off
slightly short, drops into the crease, swats a cut in front of square to the sweeper
flat on the stumps, punched off the back foot and Rashid throws himself to his right to field in his follow through
goes across on off stump and steers the ball square
dug in short, doesn't get up that much, Chandi swivels on a pull to fine leg
slightly back of a length, Mathews plays this softly down into a gap at midwicket for one
good length outside off, tapped gently towards point
oof, Chandimal takes a blow on the body... 87mph and nibbling back in, clips the inside edge and lands amidships. Chandi need a moment to catch his breath
short and wide, counterstrike from the batsman, a leaping uppercut over backward point and it races away for a boundary
flighted, little bit of grip on the legbreak, poked into the covers
tossed up and Mathews goes for the sweep, big swish across the line and he gets a thick top edge over short fine leg, slightly lucky once again
pushed through, skids on to the pads and runs away square
floated up around off stump, driven down the ground for one
Rashid gives it a rip, spinning away outside off, lets it through to the keeper
Chandimal prods the ball into the covers, good pick up and throw and it's another direct hit... but Mathews was in, Reiffel happy not to consult the third umpire
back of a length, Chandimal jumps into line and nudges one down in front of square leg
length outside off, 87mph and punched on the up to cover
sliding down the leg side, Mathews is unlucky in that it flicks his pad, so won't be a wide
back of a length outside off, 86mph and steered through point
good pace and worked into a gap on the leg side from back in the crease
length ball, coming back in and hits the thigh pad
tossed up from over the wicket, tapped back to the bowler
loopy line and teasing length, turning towards an expectant slip but pushed back to the bowler
down on one knee, into a measured sweep
back and across, defended on the back foot
big spin from a full length and a pretty ugly slap of a cut, up and over the slip. Effective enough, he got plenty bat on it, but the bounce nearly did for him
good riposte, fuller and tighter, held back in flight and defended back down the track
worked off the straight and narrow, out to square leg
back into the crease to flick a wide delivery outside off to Roy at midwicket, who fumbles as he stoops to gather
punched to cover
worked with supple wrists to midwicket, off the back foot
tossed up and tapped down to long-on
well bowled, drawing the batsman forward and fielding in his followthrough
beautiful flight and line once again, nudged calmly with the spin to cover to steal another single
nicely flighted, dipping onto leg stump and blocked stoutly from the crease
a bit wider, looked for a moment like the googly, but Mathews waits and waits and slaps to deep cover
bat and pad, tight together, squirted to leg
slow and teasing leg-break, just a fraction back of a comfortable length and dipping late. Well bowled
a half-appeal to finish another exceptionally controlled over
whipped to leg from outside off, Mathews has apparently called for a heavier bat. Let's see how that goes...
well, that's gone! Tossed up outside leg, so Mathews flips his wrists around to blat a reverse slog-sweep behind square. Shot
forward and blocked back down the track
more conventional sweep, more of a premeditated deflection really
dabbed to midwicket
worked off the pads once again, and that should have been the end of it, but Root's shy from midwicket gifts an overthrow. England have been mostly pretty tidy in the field
driven with the spin out to cover, and an insta-call ...
tossed up very full, on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
cut firmly out to point but Willey pounces to prevent the run. Slightly shorter and wider
tossed up again, poked back to the bowler
very full, turning gently, pushed to cover
wide of off stump, more sharp turn, left alone
eased down to long-on
clipped out to midwicket, walking into the stroke
forward and defended to cover
shovelled out to deep square leg, like a man flicking snow over his shoulder
using the spin once more, angled out to midwicket
fuller length, a bit quicker, and dabbed to leg again. Economical
full length, tight line
worked to leg again
just a hint of width to work with, slapped out to cover
loopy loopy, right up above the eyeline, pushed to mid-off
much shorter, dragged down as Rashid slid in a quicker delivery, but Chandimal was waiting and butchered it through backward point
back on a better length, defended
clipped to midwicket
an ambitious sweep, meeting Ali's line, way outside off, but not connecting
this one is a connection, but not enough of one! Another sweep, flipping up and under to Woakes at backward square, who barely had to move as the ball plopped into his mitts!
worked to leg, he comes the HeatSeekker to take guard for the first time...
a measured start, shovelling a leg-stump delivery to midwicket
forward, angled bat, worked to leg. A fine over comes to an end ... two runs and a wicket
a hint of width, cut firmly out to point
a loopy full length, outside off, defended

wow, what's happened here? An inside-edge, chopped dramatically down into the crease, somehow it misses the stumps, but there's a loud appeal from Buttler who takes the rebound. Is this off the toe? The umpires are having a look... but no, it is not. Straight into the turf
leg-stump line, clipped to midwicket
driven down the ground, playing very much within himself to see off the spin threat
quicker and flatter, chopped down into the cordon to end another economical over
good areas, Mo, good areas ...

that's a perfect Test-match offbreak! Tight line, leaping off the deck to cannon off the edge and straight into the hands of first slip ... except this is an ODI, so it zips through third man for four instead!
on the pads, and leaking runs all of a sudden
onto a better line and length, defended
angled defence into the leg side
up onto the toes, punched out to cover
up onto the toes to defend. Rashid fields
forward, calmly patted to cover
that's a dirty slog, nothing Rashid could do about that. A hoick through the leg-side, off a rare googly, and got enough bat to fizz through midwicket
forward and defended, rattling through his spell
tossed up and dipping late, Prasanna is already admiring his intended slogged six over midwicket as the ball slips under his blade and into Buttler's gloves
dipping and turning, that is a fine if under-rewarded spell
clipped to square leg
a wafty uppercut to mid-on
flicked from off to leg, knocking at the door but can't pierce the leg-side ring
onto the back foot, punched uppishly to cover
into position for a flick over the shoulder
tumbling stop at backward square as the HeatSeekker lines up another slog-sweep
hitting the deck, fended out to point
on the toes, chiselled to leg
banged in short, that's one for the over
top-edged pull, another sharp delivery, but there's too much pace on that and the batsman reaps the rewards over fine leg!
fuller and straighter, defended to mid-off
that's a wallop and a half! Short again, picks the length early and though Hales leaps valiantly that's clean over the ropes at square leg!
delicate sweep behind square
not-so-delicate sweep, up and over backward square! Blam!
Bosh! This one goes galloping down the Bridgford Road! Prasanna plants his front foot and flings his levers into gear!
forward and blocked down the ground
swept again, excellent manipulation of the field as this one pierces the newly created gap at backward square. Well, this has escalated quickly...
forward and pressed into the covers
pushed back into the crease, clipped fine
a dirty leg-side head-high full-toss, that is all manner of wrong. Flashed behind square, and here comes a free hit too
low full toss, belted through midwicket. That's his fifty!
heaved through the leg-side, Prasanna is unstoppable, but Plunkett is feeding a clear strength with that line into the pads and beyond
over-compensates, outside off and flogged on the up through the covers! The HeatSeekker is on fire and he is grinning like a loon as well. Great to see
low-full toss, but a tighter line, chipped to mid-on and that's a rare non-boundary
pushed into the crease to finish a violent over
that'll do! A decent length to open his account, and a pumped-up Prasanna roundhouses a pull that isn't there for the shot, and wellies a miscue off the splice and straight back to the bowler
on the hip, turned to square leg
hops into line to clip another single through backward square
cut through backward point
tight line and length, defended down into the crease
well bowled, probing line outside off, and that's an important breakthrough over
round the wicket, to Tharanga, who slices a single down to third man
now Mathews takes up the cudgels, skips out and lathers a drive over the covers, made room to free the arms and got it well in front of the sweeper
pitched up, closer to the stumps but met with a lovely straight drive, whizzing past Plunkett's toes for one to long-off

full and wide, Tharanga chases it and nicks off! His strange return down the order continues to baffle, the ball was a bit too far away from him to drive and he only succeeded in squeezing an edge through to the keeper
Plunkett pitches the ball up in the channel, met with the face of the bat but steered to extra cover and Mathews sends him back
full and angling in on middle and leg, 86mph and glanced through midwicket for one to get off the mark
tossed up from over the wicket, played back to the bowler
pushed through on the stumps, goes back and turns the ball to midwicket
bit of width, Shanaka opens the face and runs it behind gully... but Rashid slides to stop and prevents a single
works the ball into the leg side
tossed up, Shanaka finally manages to get the ball away down to long-off
darted on the stumps, Mathews nudges one more to leg, closing in on fifty
moves across on off and defends back to the bowler
fuller and tailing in on the stumps, dug out through mid-on for one
in the channel, 82mph and guided down to third man with an open face
on the stumps, Mathews can't get it away
short ball, jumps back and defends in front of the stumps
fuller, outside off, Mathews was on his heels and doesn't get hold of his drive
overpitched from Moeen and it's whistled away through the covers, punchy drive from Shanaka for his first boundary
pushed through quicker on the stumps, worked to leg
tossed up on off, Mathews works it through midwicket with a flick of the wrists
flat offbreak on the stumps, can't get it away past square leg
here comes Dasun indeed! Couple of steps out and a lofted smack down the ground, right through the line and well clear of the rope at long-on
Moeen fires the ball down outside off, dabbed to short third man
over the wicket and sliding across the left-hander, driven through backward point
fullish and dug out back down the ground
pitched up in the slot, Shanaka punches to extra cover, who sprawls but doesn't stop it cleanly
full outside off, 81mph and dispatched along the ground to long-off - raises the bat for his half-century, applause from the team balcony, but they need him to go on
full on the stumps, tickled towards mid-on, who's back on the edge of the circle and they get one
pitched up slightly wide, throws the hands through a meaty drive but picks out extra cover
pitched up, tailing in on the stumps, dug out towards mid-on, who slips trying to field and they get one
on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler
angled in with the arm and worked through midwicket for a single
hangs this outside off, length ball rising past the outside edge as Shanaka dangles his bat out
bouncer, down the leg side... and too high
pitched up in the corridor, gets on to the front foot and steers a drive through the covers
full outside off, Mathews strretches out and pings one more through extra cover to keep the strike

driven, straight to extra cover, excellent stop by Plunkett diving one-handed to his right... and Shanaka is stranded, no time to get back to the non-striker's end! That's not the way to start your final push, Shanaka was backing up a long way and by the time Mathews sent him back he was too far down, committed to the single that never materialised
back of a length, defended on the stumps
tight lines from Willey, played back to the bowler
length ball on the stumps, Mathews manages to squeeze it through his legs off an inside edge
full outside off, reaches for a languid-looking drive through cover
on the stumps, Mathews again can't get it away - two off the over and SL are limping down the final straight
floated up on middle and off, leans out round the front pad and turns the ball square

Moeen drags the ball down as Mathews gives him the charge, bit of a mishit as he heaves to leg, still gets plenty of power on the shot and it bisects long-on and deep midwicket to bounce away for four
tossed up and punched through mid-off
flat on the stumps, Maharoof goes back and works to leg, turns the strike over
flat offbreak on middle stump, dabbed down into a gap at midwicket
pushed through on the stumps and this time Maharoof clips it straight to midwicket
strays on to the pads and Mathews only needs to divert it fine to pick up four
on the stumps, touch short and defended from the crease
fuller, flicked off middle and leg for one through midwicket
pitched up, sliding across the bows, driven down the ground to long-ogg
Willey concentrating his attack on the stumps, nurdled into the midwicket region for one more
on the pads and clipped in front of square on the leg side
short of a length, 84mph and tucked to leg off the back foot
Plunkett digs it in again, genuine bouncer to Maharoof, who nods his head underneath
shortish, stays back in the crease and blocks
shuffles into line on off stump and taps the ball away
shortish again, this time Maharoof lobs it in the air but short of midwicket
full and sliding on to leg stump, 84mph and glanced down to fine leg for a single
fullish, 80mph on middle and leg, punched through mid-on
on the stumps and worked into the leg side for one more
possibly a slower ball from Willey, plopping down on off stump as Maharoof pushes hard it it, gets one down to long-on
pitched up on middle and leg, clipped through square leg - SL dealing in singles
touch back of a length, shows it a straight bat as he walks forward, pushed back past the bowler
a couple to finish the over, Mathews flicking through backward square leg - that's the SL 250 up, with five overs to go
starts with a leg-side wide, though it very nearly flicked the thigh pad
slightly short outside the line of off, stays back and steers a single through point
touch back of a length, 85mph outside off, Mathews only succeeds in dabbing it back to the bowler
slower ball, sitting up outside off, Mathews short-arms it through square leg for a single
short ball, pulled through leg for one more
lovely line, gets it to straighten a fraction, past the outside edge
moves across and flaps one more through the covers
pitched up and dribbled back down the ground for one
cross-seam from Plunkett, good pace and it zips through a few inches wide of the timber as Maharoof has a woolly woof across the line
swings to leg, taken on the full... and it sails behind the rope for six! Used the pace well and it was just a nonchalant flick of the wrists to send it all the way
another low full toss and Maharoof scoops it over midwicket for a couple, bouncing in front the fielder running round
Plunkett slings down a full bunger, clipped to the man on the fence for one

goes full, up towards the blockhole, Mathews plays to leg and gets a leading edge... safely taken at mid-off! Big wicket for England, Plunkett's second and another one pouched by Woakes running in from the boundary
full and straight, Lakmal bunts it through mid-on for a single
pitched up on off stump, nicely played with a wristy flick back down the ground
dug in short, rides the bounce and knocks it down into the leg side, one more to the total
short ball, maybe a slower delivery but dragged slightly leg side and Maharoof rocks back to swat it away fine for four. That'll help
full and tailing in on the stumps, glanced through midwicket for a single
good length in the corridor, met on the front foot and blocked towards mid-off, they set off straight away and pinch one more
on the stumps and punched back past the bowler
Maharoof comes on to the front foot and nudges to long-off
slower ball from Willey, turned short into the leg side and they charge through for one more
pitched up outside off, Maharoof pokes into the covers and hustles one more
another cutter, on the pads and Lakmal misses with a flick, deflects away off his legs

goes for the slog down the ground, mistimed and it's going to land up straight in long-on's bread baske... oh, dropped! Root picks up the ball at the second attempted and hurls it in with a face like thunder. Bit of a howler, that, though you don't see them often from Root
pitched up, swings hard buts whacks it to mid-off on the full
full, cross-seam delivery, fading on middle and leg, scooped in the air but lands safely
banged in short and flapped away from back in the crease
slower delivery, full and wide and driven for one through the covers
Lakmal goes bouncing across his stumps like he's the Easter bunny, manages to get a toe of bat on a glance to fine leg
no... it's pitched up towards the blockhole and punched down the ground, they desperately try and come back for two but Lakmal is well short as the throw comes in and Woakes breaks the stumps

inn2.comm: decent line and length, deflected into the covers
climbing off a full length, a good Test-match line, tight back-foot defence into the covers
angled bat, on the back foot, pushed to cover
on the back foot, dabbed into the covers once again. Good probing length
deflected into the leg-side, good wicket-to-wicket line
tip and run, a stab to mid-on and a sharp call
straight lines, turned off middle stump to the leg side
outside off, lifting into the keeper's gloves, standing up to the bat
tight line, attacking the top of off. solid defence
big appeal and up goes the finger! Nothing fancy in that from Mathews, just a perfect wicket-to-wicket line, a bit of nip off the seam and a fat thump into a planted front pad. Off he goes!
onto the back foot, hustled defence
onto the front foot, calmly guided to mid-off
drilled into the covers, feet not really moving but Hales' hands are alert as he survives his first ball. It's been eventful watching from the non-striker's end
an inside-out drive, a bit of a fat inside-edge, and that is a lightning outfield. Midwicket dives in vain and those are runs
punched back to the bowler, who reaches to intercept in his followthrough
forward once again, point tidies up

massive appeal, and Hales is gone too! In fact he is reviewing first, but if he hasn't hit this, then surely he's lbw! Fizzing line and length, met on the front pad by a late-arriving bat, and the ball flies off a combination of inside edge and pad-flap, straight to midwicket! Hales is utterly non-plussed, tied in knots by Lakmal's command of length!
Morgan shoulders arms, it is all happening
chiselled out to midwicket
short and smashed, Morgan hops like a bunny on a trampoline to get over the top of a looping bouncer and pounds it through midwicket
width, and left alone. No rush here
more width, Morgan has a go this time but can't connect properly as point tidies up
angled across the left-hander, and with a slip in place it's a dangerous line. Morgan half-chases, half-leaves, and doesn't make contact
deflected down to third man to keep the strike
tidy line to the left-hander from both ends, full length and outside off, angled away from the left-hander. This looks like a well-thought-out ploy
tighter, Morgan hops back into line to defend
back of a length, but once again angling towards the cordon. Morgan defends
outside off, chopped down to third man
good line to the left-hander, but Root is right-handed. Flicked off the pads and Maharoof at backward square gathers well on the boundary's edge
open-faced steer down to third man, England content to deal in singles for the moment
slower ball, angled across the left-hander, defended
zippier pace and Morgan has a flirt, doesn't connect, luckily for him
nibbled to third man, probing line again
big inducker, and Root readjusts late to defend on the back foot. Inside-edge into the pads

another inducker, and Root is all at sea for this one! A 77mph stump-splatterer, just ghosting in from outside off, inexorably inwards. Root plays back, plays round it, loses his off pole, and his relative slump in form continues...
defended on the back foot, another fine over is over
beautiful straight drive, half-stopped at mid-off, but the ball seemed to pick up pace after the partial interception from Shanaka
perfect line and length to Morgan, shaping away, but starting oh-so-straight. Treated with respect
on the back foot, defended to cover
tidy (yes, really) line and length. Defended

that's the shot they were bowling for! Morgan played straight into the trap, but like a mouse who guzzles all the cheese, sniffs the spring, then legs it all the same, his flirt through the cordon eludes a wide lone slip and fizzes away for four!
tighter line, solid defence
forward and defended to cover
dropped! Clipped off the front pad, straight to midwicket and the chance goes begging! Mendis dived, saw it all the way, and really should have swallowed that!
worked off the pads again
width and bounce, again angling to third man. Morgan is flirting preposterously outside off. Should Mrs Morgan be informed?
dabbed to third man once again, singles in that region are all he can hope for with this line of attack
on the pads, whisked away, and they jog back for the second
angled across again, but short enough to watch onto the middle of a measured cut to deep backward point
good line and length, driven on the up with a hint of nibble off the deck, and Bairstow's tentative push is swallowed at point!
tight line, defended on the back foot
oh lummie, a direct hit from cover as Buttler scampers off the mark! He's made it, but steady on!
sharp pace and good bounce through to the keeper, Sri Lanka are pumped!
width and slashed in the air through gully! Morgan knows what Sri Lanka are bowling for, and does he give a fig? He does not ...
wicket to wicket, raps the pad as Buttler attempts to flick to leg
angled defence into the point region
on the back foot, defended to cover
clipped firmly through backward square
on the pads, clipped to leg
inside-edged defence out through square leg. Not a lot for England to write home about at the end of the Powerplay...
back and across, into line as Lakmal maintains that exemplary line across the left-hander
onto the back foot again, battering away at the top of off, with a threat of movement towards the slips. Defended
big stride onto the front foot, a good-looking defensive stroke. Almost looked like the basis of something more expansive...
fizzing through to the keeper! Morgan was expecting the bouncer with the men set back, but it was full and fuller and Morgan's weight was never into the flashing drive. Lucky to get away with it
wider, and Morgan gratefully ignores it
driven with confidence! That's Morgan's best shot so far, and this time his weight was all in the right place, leaning into the drive and piercing the covers. That'll cheer him up
blocked on the front dog
flicked to leg, another single
short, and another hop-pull from Morgan, lots of aggression, and an awful shy from midwicket gifts an extra run!
manipulates the strike once again, he's starting to play his own game now, rather than the one Sri Lanka want him to play ...
attempted ramp, that was technically a drop, through the keeper was too busy diving for safety as Buttler's limbs went loco ...
onto the front foot again, driven to cover
flung out wide, Buttler chases a drive and inside-edges to square leg
that's a great shot, full face, firm drive, not over-hitting it, just timing the pants off it. No cutting that off
over-pitched with a bit of width, Morgan drives with a lot of bottom hand, into the covers
wide and swinging wider, Buttler puts his bat through the line to pick off another driven single
tight line, solid defence
belted! Too wide and full, and Morgan latches onto the offering, driven crisply through the covers. The skipper's starting to find his range now
on the back foot, defended back down the pitch
tight line again, tapped to cover and a good confident call brings a quick single
outside off, climbing through to the keeper as Morgan flirts with that troublesome angle across the left-hander again
outside off again, left alone this time
tight line, defended back down the pitch
that's a crisp drive, but the sweeper is in place on the Bridgford Road boundary, and a good over from Pradeep comes to an end
outside off, banging through to the keeper
clobbered out to cover, half a step down the track to meet the pitch
tip and run, confident play
chopped into the gully
shorter and wider, crunched into the covers with a flamboyant chop, well intercepted with a tumble in the deep
wide once again, Morgan cuts once more but this one doesn't get up
up onto the toes, tapped to cover
driven, almost guided, in the air, but inches wide of the diving Maharoof at mid-off! Was never to the pitch of the ball, but he just managed to find enough of the gap!
fuller length, tighter defence
clipped off the pads, out to midwicket
lively at the crease, walking across to the off side to work another single to leg

gone! And you can guess the mode of departure! Morgan has been threatening to play catching practice with the slips throughout his peculiar knock, and he finally departs, on the stroke of drinks, to that very stroke! A battling performance from the captain, with a handful of trademark drives down the ground. But he's at odds with himself at the moment ...
targets the stumps, Buttler walks across and clips one down to fine leg
good length, climbing through in the channel, left alone
stays over the wicket, sliding the ball towards slip, Moeen strokes it to point
tighter line, steps on to off stump and defends with a straight bat
touch short of a length and Moeen frees the arms to steer a single in front of point
Maharoof goes too straight, this is nudged firmly in front of deep midwicket, not quite enough for it to run away from the sweeper but they get two more
charges in, bangs out a tattoo halfway down, Moeen dab it to leg
short and wide and slapped through the covers, no-nonsense swing of the bat from Moeen and that brings him a first boundary
closer to the stumps, moves into line and pushes to extra cover
short, 85mph and rising towards the ribs, neatly tucked away in front of deep square leg for a couple
pitched up around off stump, no devil in this, pushed calmly to mid-off

short outside off, Moeen opens up to cut... and chops on! Pradeep strikes again, a rather vapid stroke from Moeen, not quite wide enough as he flashed a wonky bat and got a thick inside down on to the woodwork. England are fast running out of back-up
tossed up and pushed back towards the bowler
pushed through around off stump, driven flat down the ground to long-off
flighted, slower and straightening on leg stump, defended
comes forward and punches a single to long-off
flatter delivery, sliding on to the pads as Buttler played back, heading down
pushed through, more topsin than legbreak, Buttler pushes tentatively away from his body and gets a thick inside edge past his pads for one
full length, too straight from Pradeep, flicked off the legs to deep backward square
length ball, 88mph from Pradeep, defended
fuller, outside off and Woakes drives to the man at extra cover

pitched up on the stumps, met with a meaty straight bat and Pradeep sticks out a boot, manages to deflect the ball up into his standing knee... winces but he's soon grinning again, trotting back to his mark
bit of width outside off, Woakes swishes one behind point
creamed through the covers on the front foot! Full outside off and he gets out to drill a drive to the short boundary
flighted, around off stump, Woakes comes forward to drive
tight lines from Prasanna, can't get it through once again
Woakes uses his feet, tries to swat down the ground, gets an inside edge on to his front boot
tossed up and this is punched back down the ground to long-on
flighted, outside the line of off, Buttler shuffles forward and bumps it into the ground towards long-off
pushed through on the stumps, worked back down the ground
bit of width, opens the face and runs a single to third man
banged in short, Buttler ducks
on the stumps, Buttler closes the face on a flick through midwicket
touch short of a good length, dropped down into the leg side and they trot the single
Buttler makes an early move across his stumps, Pradeep sends a slower ball down the leg side... That's a wide
banged in short down the leg side, Buttler ducks... and Reiffel is happy enough
another cutter, bobbles down the leg side - flicked the pad, so that's fine, too. Four off the over
tossed up and Woakes reaches for a gentle drive to mid-off
slightly shorter, goes back in the crease and dabs down square on the leg side
topspinning legbreak on off stump, Buttler tries to reverse the hands and whip it away through backward point... but misses and is hit on the gloves
pushed through outside off as Buttler advances, bat firmly next to pad and it's shinned through cover - umpire Bailey deems he was playing a shot, so that's the England 100, to low murmuring
floated up and driven into a gap for one more
full length outside off, Buttler opens up to hit a drive wide of long-off, they scamper back for two
slower ball, legcutter outside off, Woakes drops it down towards point
another slower delivery, chipped in the air coming forwards but short of mid-off, who's back a bit
pitched up and Buttler escorts it through the off side for four, just a cordial push but it races by the sweeper out on the boundary
Maharoof drops in the legcutter again, glided down to third man
on the stumps, worked softly towards mid-on
bit of width and Woakes swats a couple through deep backward point
tries to skip down the pitch, the ball scuds into the pads
tossed up and worked back past the bowler for one
on the stumps, Woakes turns to leg
drops back and steers one square on the off side
pushed through outside the line of off, Buttler advances and slaps through cover
flat on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
pitched up and worked in front of deep midwicket, the throw is good and Maharoof breaks the stumps but Buttler was home
too straight again from Maharoof and Woakes clips a couple more into a gap
defneded into the off side coming forwards
length ball outside off, scrambled seam and Woakes swishes at it and misses
does him with the cutter this time, Woakes pushing forward and the ball bobbling through past the outside edge
fullish, stabbed into the covers
pushed through outside off, sliced towards short third man
flat on the stumps and Buttler can't get it away through midwicket
darted on off stump, 53mph but whipped through the covers with fast hands
tossed up and nudged into a gap in front of square
pushed through flat, Buttler turns this into the leg side for one
gives this a little more air, straightening on middle and leg, Woakes defends
Maharoof is bowling almost exclusively slower balls, this lollipops up outside off and Buttler lashes it through point, there's a man tumbling on the rope to prevent four
in the channel, comes forward and pushes uppishly through mid-off
straighter line from Maharoof, tapped to the leg side
full, bit of width, Woakes swings the arms but skews it to backward point
dobbly medium pace on the stumps, driven down the ground
angled in on the pads, Buttler pushes one more to long-on

high arm, tossed up and HELLO!!! No turn and Buttler dances forward, absolutely smokes a drive into the building behind the long-off boundary. Massive blow (though still only worth six) and it brings up Buttler's fifty
speared in at the toes and Buttler defends this time
pushed through outside off, steered through the covers
on the stumps, Woakes nudges a single to leg
flighted, on off stump, driven back and Prasanna can't prevent it getting past him for one
pushed through flat on the stumps, blocked
scuttles in and floats the ball up on off stump, Buttler defends it cautiously
gentle medium pace, goes a little straighter, clipped off the legs through midwicket
bit of width, goes across and steers one to third man
slower ball, wide of the stumps and Buttler checks his drive
floated up outside off and Buttler squeezes his bat down on it
drops short and Buttler slams a pull through square leg to finish the over with a muscular boundary
good length outside off and it's met with a stonking front-foot drive on the up, lovely timing and deep extra cover has his work cut out to try and cut it off with a slide on the boundary
Buttler scoots across his stumps, Lakmal spots him and fires it down the leg side, out of reach of the scoop... but still a wide
back of a length, around off stump, stabbed down in front of square
filthy full toss from Lakmal, just dips below waits height at Buttler clips it through square leg, again a good stop on the boundary prevents four
Lakmal draws the edge, Buttler reaching for a slower ball, I think, but it flies wide of Chandimal and runs away for four. Frustration builds
full on the stumps, clubbed into the ground but straight to midwicket
full length, comes forward to punch through extra cover... literally, as a misfield hands them one more
on the stumps, length ball but nurdled to midwicket
bit of width, Buttler goes back and across and dabs one to third man
shortish, played off the back foot in front of midwicket, who sprawls but allows the ball past him and they run another welcome single
good length outside off, there's a real crack off the bat as Buttler drives, just one into the deep
tight, wicket-to-wicket line, 78mph and defended
moves across, dropped into the off side and they hustle one more as the throw comes in
tossed up and driven through mid-off to the man in the deep
on the stumps, Buttler turns it to leg without success
flat delivery, punched towards cover
floated up, skips out and drives one down the ground
angled in on the stumps, Woakes works the ball back past the bowler for one more
pushed through flat outside off, Buttler punches to cover - good over for SL, just three off it
round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, pushed through mid-off
slightly leg side and it's tucked through backward square... should only be one but there's a bit of a mix up and they hurry back for a second
flat offbreak on leg stump, driven down the ground
lovely stuff from Woakes, makes a move down the pitch and then strokes the ball inside out over cover, it's a vacant part of the field and bounces away
on the stumps and punched back down the ground
floated up on the stumps, Buttler drills another single to long-on
a twirly length outside off stump, driven with intent to cover
drawn down the track, good footwork and well fielded in the followthrough
good intent, confident advance, and driven to cover
clipped to leg to steal another single
thumped on the up to wide mid-off

flicked, airily, just wide of midwicket! Woakes made good ground to meet the ball, but the fielder tried to anticipate where the ball was going, and rather like the Slovakian keeper against Gareth Bale, he makes a meal of it!
defended from the crease, into the leg side
very straight, and superbly worked off the pads, very fine and there's no cutting that off. England are brawling
strong stride and a full-faced push through the line
short, and pulled with good control, rolling the wrists out to deep square leg

flapped round the corner, straight to the fielder but Buttler was already calling them through. The direct-hit comes in from short backward square, but he's safely home. And that is the hundred partnership. Pradeep, in the middle of the pitch, was almost felled by the flying bail!
another single, this pair are working it
onto the front foot, finds the gap with a teasingly timed drive that requires two men to sprint right to the boundary's edge to pull it back. They do well and save one run ...
slower ball, Buttler hangs his bat out to defend
tapped to cover, another sharp call. Keep stealing those for another ten overs, and England will be almost there ...
outside off, firm hands and edged down to third man. No slips, no danger
flashed out to the leg side, another easy single
another edge, a more conventional one this time. That would have been scooped up by third slip if England were batting out for a draw in a Test match from this position ...
onto the front foot, driven to mid-off
flashed through the covers, just placing the bat in the way and letting the timing do the rest. A well-earned single to the sweeper
ooh, you cheeky so-and-so. Buttler dances at the crease, turns his stance inside-out, waits for the ball to reach the top of his leg stump, and dinks it over the keeper's head. Cunningly played!
another attempted scoop, but this is a bit faster and sharper, and there's no contact as the ball whistles by
back to conventional belligerence, onto the front foot to pull through square leg
dabbed through third man and up comes Woakes' maiden ODI fifty. It's been an invaluable support act, and he has given England every chance of saving their bacon in this game
floated up outside off, and wafted into the covers
thumped into the covers, same direction, ten times the intent
another edge, but there are no slips on duty, they all count now
defended down the track
width and clumped out to the covers
the runs keep coming ...
inswinging full toss, guided to midwicket

another low full toss, clipped in the same direction, and this time they set off for the single. Woakes makes his ground easily enough but wears a wayward shy on the forearm. Ouch. There's a pause for the moment as Woakes gets some treatment
flicked off the pads to get things going once again
on the pads, sliding down, Buttler tries to help it on its way but the keeper does well to intercept
dug out from a full length, worked up to mid-on
back and across, worked to midwicket but a tight line keeps the damage down. A protracted over, but a good one for Sri Lanka
tossed out wide, a massive appeal as Buttler swishes, but mostly to put the umpire off calling the wide. It worked...
lots of width again, and held back in the flight. Teasing, but met with a confident swat into the covers
onto the back foot, defended to leg and another fine call
solidly forward and defended to cover
drilled into the covers, lots of wrists and bottom hand
wide of off stump once again, Buttler lines up the reverse slap but can't reach it. An effective line, that...

that's an excellent line, leaping off a good length, and there's a strong temptation to review as Woakes flirts outside off ... indeed, they will ... there's nothing on HotSpot, or Snicko. So as you were.
worked out to leg, just a single
dropped! A spank into the covers, all power, no finesse, and that would have been a stunning snaffle by Prasanna, at full stretch at short cover. Sharp work ...
worked out to point
premeditated advance, Maharoof drops short and Woakes responds with a dab to mid-on, and a very loud expression of Anglo-Saxon discontent. Feisty
worked to the leg side once again
patted with intent out to deep backward point, and they jog back for the second run
dancing at the crease, and all sorts going on there, Prasanna completely altered his line, in a bid to get Woakes stumped down the leg-side, and nearly got a deflection onto the stumps

what a catch! Buttler dragged the ball from outside off, aiming for the six over long-on, where Shanaka had to time his leap to perfection, and mind where he landed afterwards, to pull off a potential gamebreaker, He had just long enough to contemplate the enormity of that moment, too ...
worked to leg from deep in the crease
held back in the flight and dabbed to leg for an instant call
worked into the gap to keep the strike
width, and Willey goes for a slap. No contact
another swing, another miss. Mid-on drops back in anticipation of contact
on the pads and good contact this time, but only as far as deep midwicket
drilled back to the bowler, who gathers well with a dive
speared into the legs, and pushed down the ground to long-on
smashed back to the bowler, baseball-style, but just short. A deflection off the shins/torso/whatever gifts another single
another swing and a miss. Willey has set out his stall. I daresay he'll find his range soon enough ...
squirted out to point and Willey hands over the hitting duties to his well-set partner
low full toss and that's a brave half-stop at short backward square
slower ball, Woakes waits and waits, and thumps on the up into the covers
full toss again, but a good one in the circumstances, wide of the crease and angling in. Woakes defends out to cover
slower ball again, and Willey is wise to it, settling for a clip to leg when his initial instinct had been to belt the bejaysus out of it
another swing and a miss! Willey wanted that so badly he almost hit it in his followthrough. Frustration ...
that's an excellent ball to a man with malice aforethought, a wide yorker and Willey has no option but to reach it with his toe-end and settle for a single to long-off
slower ball again, back of a length, and Woakes pokes uppishly to point

Willey finally makes contact but his attempted smear to leg ends up as a leading edge to deep extra cover! That might be a mercy ... but what is this? This looks dangerously close to a no-ball. I'd give him the benefit, but it's so tight... he's out!
slashed up and out through third man, but two men converge to cut it off
tight line on the pads, Plunkett plays it calmly out to deep midwicket and they are back for two. That's the rate they need ...
full length and swinging in, Woakes smashes on the up into the covers. No finesse, but there's not really time for any at the moment ...
speared into the pads, flicked down to the leg-side and they rush through for another single
yorker, well bowled, and reasonably well played, an angled deflection into the cordon and they pick off the single
whoops, that'll help the cause, down the leg side
full length into the legs, Plunkett clears his limbs out of the way, belts his bat through the line but Shanaka at long-on is nutmegged by the lack of contact, and lets a four ping through his legs!
good riposte, full and straight, and jabbed back to the bowler
a big wind-up but no real contact. That's another fine over, as England's chase gets that little bit more distant
short, and walloped fiercely out to deep midwicket. But straight to the man ...
another single, England need a boundary urgently
another smack through the leg-side, short again
in the slot at last, and Woakes holds his shape to nine-iron it back over the bowler's head. Millimetres short of the rope, but vital all the same
a cross-batted smear, and excellent running turns a miscue into two valuable runs
inside-out lofted drive, good contact but the placement is lacking as deep extra cover tidies up

low full toss, and spanked through the covers, a stunning dive cuts off the boundary, and Danushka flaps like a beached haddock to get his body back over the rope without touching the ball. Excellent work!
scooped for four! Vital runs, Plunkett made his intentions plain before the ball had arrived, but nailed it all the same
speared down the leg side, as Plunkett made room and the bowler followed him. And England steal the bye too ... this is getting tight once again ...
wide of off stump, guided out to deep point with a flat bat. One more ...
another shimmy down the leg-side, and Lakmal follows him once again, gets it in the blockhole this time, and worked to mid-on

scooped again, over the keeper and short fine leg, and a teasing chase for Maharoof, who oddly chooses to dive with his feet, when a face-first dive might just have hauled it in at fine leg! This is turning into a massive over ... one ball here could make the difference now
full toss, walloped out to midwicket, and though Woakes keeps the strike he's livid he didn't put that out of the ground ...
slower ball, battered on the up to long-off and Plunkett gallops like a rogue mule to get back for the second run ... 12 from five...
yorker, that's superb. Woakes has no choice but to lay bat on ball and save his stumps from being splattered
another yorker, inswinging into the pads, and bundled out into the off-side off inside-edge and pad. England get the run, but they need boundaries now ...
attempted yorker, inswinging, and Pradeep pounces in his followthrough. Woakes had given up on getting back to his crease but the shy goes inches wide ... dot ball ..

stunning bowling, right up in the blockhole, but England somehow scamper back for three to fine leg, even as Sri Lanka were celebrating! A bit soon for that because ... six to tie, and Plunkett's big levers on strike!

wow! Plunkett clears the front dog, leans back for glory, and blatters the ball high over long-off! Pradeep's yorker was a millimetre shy of perfection, and that was all the excuse the big man needed!
